description: Two storey side extension; single storey rear extension
decision_conditions: <p>The proposed single storey rear extension, by reason of its depth and siting would give rise to an overbearing, unneighbourly and visually obtrusive form of development which would result in an unacceptable impact on the amenity&nbsp;of No. 50 Rowlands Avenue in terms of adverse outlook, overshadowing, and overbearing impacts.&nbsp;The proposed development would thereby be contrary to Policy D3 D (7) of the London Plan (2023), Policy DM1 of the Development Management Policies Local Plan document (2013) and the relevant provisions of the adopted Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).<br></p>

<p>The proposed&nbsp;two storey side extension by reason of the inappropriate&nbsp;and incongruous flat roof design, would result in a discordant&nbsp;and out of keeping addition, which would appear unduly at odds with the established pattern of built form within the area and&nbsp;would be detrimental to the character and appearance of the original dwelling,&nbsp;street scene and area in a wider context,&nbsp;contrary to the high quality design aspirations set out in The National Planning Policy Framework (2023), policies D3 (D(1) and D(11)) of The London Plan (2021), Policy CS1.B on the Harrow Core Strategy (2012), Policy DM1 of the Development Management Local Plans Policies (2013) and &nbsp;Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).<br></p>
